dt: {bc}to heat (something, such as inorganic materials) to a high temperature but without fusing in order to drive off volatile matter or to effect changes (such as oxidation or pulverization)

et: Middle English {it}calcenen{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}calcinare{/it}, from Late Latin {it}calcina{/it} lime, from Latin {it}calc-, calx{/it}
shortdef: to heat (something, such as inorganic materials) to a high temperature but without fusing in order to drive off volatile matter or to effect changes (such as oxidation or pulverization)

dt: {bc}a product (such as a metal oxide) of {a_link|calcination} or roasting

shortdef: a product (such as a metal oxide) of calcination or roasting
